Posts.Content: Hi everyone So I had my 6 month follow up yesterday ( 7 months post op) My consultant noted that the breast I had the op on is bigger than the other, hadn't really noticed but do now, ( always been an A so don't mind bit extra but is this a normal thing to happen after lumpectomy/radio? I also asked him about the yellow crusty stuff on this nipple, he said for 1 in 100 it could be cancer in the milk ducts but said he wouldn't investigate further till my 1 yr mammogram in August as it might settle down and be nothing, not exactly reassuring BUT am refusing to worry. 7 months on am feeling great despite the TamoxifenðŸ˜„ Thoughts with you all Sue x
Posts.Title: 6 month follow up

Posts.Content: Hi Sandi i had a lumpectomy last October and rads in January so one year down the line and all wellI too have lumps around my scar. My consultant said it is scar tissue and I am seeing someone about having some laser treatment on it as it is still a bit stiff and still a bit sore to touch. Always best to check it out but just wanted to tell you of my experience God bless Sue x
